alert.note: Alert for Humboldt; Pocahontas; Webster (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 2:08PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN WEBSTER... SOUTHEASTERN POCAHONTAS AND SOUTHWESTERN HUMBOLDT COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM CDT... At 207 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Fort Dodge Regional Airport, or 10 miles northwest of Fort Dodge, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail and additional rainfall up to one inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Locations impacted include... Fort Dodge, Humboldt, Fort Dodge Regional Airport, Gilmore City, Barnum, Clare, Rutland, Pioneer, Frank A Gotch State Park, and Humboldt Municipal Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, north central and northwestern Iowa.
